subsc: General education sector,Health,Other social services,Central government administration
trustfund:
TF051333-JSDF-PERU: GIVING VOICE TO THE
            POOR IN INFLUENCING, PLANNING AND EVALUA

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Programmatic Social Reform
            Loan Project builds on the country's programmatic
            structural adjustment program in support of the medium-term
            social reform policy, and, is a critical element of the
            Bank's assistance to the Government's development
            strategy. Specifically, the project will: 1) establish a
            pro-poor social expenditure regime, and adequate social
            protection mechanisms for the poor; 2) improve access by the
            poor to critical social programs, by improving targeted
            assistance, efficiency, and rationalization of expenditures;
            and, 3) improve transparency in social programs, and
            expenditures, as well as empower beneficiaries to
            participate in policy, and budget processes. However, the
            project differs from the previous programmatic operation in
            a major way, at three levels: it attempts to link structural
            adjustment actions with medium-term results indicators (many
            related to the Millennium Development Goals); it facilitates
            transition from short-term budget protection during a
            prolonged economic slowdown, to a medium-term shift in pubic
            expenditure to benefit the poor; and, it supports a
            consistent program of social reforms, with a series of
            single tranche adjustment loans, complemented closely by
            technical assistance, and programmatic investment loans in
            health, and education.
